intro: Pentanisia sykesii subsp. otomerioides, commonly known as the Otomerioides pentanisia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. This subspecies is native to specific regions in Africa and is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats.
